page.syntax: string as C = line_insert(C string ,C string_to_insert ,* position [,L before ])

argument.name: string_to_insert
argument.description: A line to insert into List. Character

argument.name: position
argument.description: Can either be a line number (numeric value) or a string found in an existing line. Position can include wildcard characters. Before .T. = Insertion made before Position; .F. = Insertion made after Position.

page.description: Inserts a CRLF delimited string into another string at the specified position. Position can either be a line number or a string found in an existing line. Position can include wildcard characters. If before is .t. then insertion is made before position.
page.discussion: The LINE_INSERT() function inserts one or more lines into a CR-LF delimited list.
page.example: ?string = green blue yellow orange purple insert = "fuschia" ?line_insert(string, insert, 2) = green blue fuschia yellow orange purple ?line_insert(string, insert, 2, .t.) = green fuschia blue yellow orange purple ?line_insert(string, insert, "orange") = green blue yellow orange fuschia purple ?line_insert(string, insert, "or*", .t.) = green blue yellow fuschia orange purple
